intro: Tabernaemontana nicobarica, commonly known as the Nicobar angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces a milky sap that is toxic. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and dense forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
